strings:
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder wot's goin' on wiv this cave, eh?
It looks natural, like, but people 'ave obviously been at work 'ere an' all.

<se_high>Jessica: This place doesn't look like Orkutsk to me.
Are we lost?

<se_def>Angelo: Steady on!
Weren't we supposed to be going to Orkutsk and looking for some herb doctor or other?
<se_def>Angelo: I know how you love your detours, <hero>, but even I draw the line at traipsing into a freezing cold cave like this with you.<page>Angelo: You can only push a man so far!
<se_low>Yangus: I bet that's the geezer we're lookin' for. Didn't expect to find 'im collapsed on the floor, mind!

<se_low>Yangus: He's in a spot o' bother there, eh?
We'd better give 'im an 'and.
<se_low>Yangus: D'ya really reckon that Marek bloke's in 'ere?
<se_low>Yangus: We're gonna feel like prize plonkers if we've come all this way for nuffin'!
<se_high>Jessica: How in the world did he end up getting trapped in a place like this!?
<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to believe he came all this way just for some herbs. People are strange.
<se_high>Jessica: So you can only cultivate herbs in a cave like this? I had no idea it was so difficult!
<se_high>Jessica: I suppose it's too cold and snowy to grow them outside.
<se_def>Angelo: Why did he have to go and collapse right in the very depths of the cave!? Of all the awkward places...
<se_def>Angelo: Still, I suppose we'd better try and help him now that we've come this far.
<se_def>Angelo: Even if we assume Marek was here gathering herbs, he shouldn't really be taking this long about it.
<se_def>Angelo: I can't help but have a bad feeling about this.

<se_def>Angelo: ...And when I get a bad feeling, I'm usually right. People are often astounded by my powers of foresight.<page>Angelo: But I assure you I'm not cheating!
There are no tarot cards up my sleeve!
<se_low>Yangus: That was nook grass in that bag then, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I could 'ardly believe it when 'e swallowed it straight!<page>Yangus: I don't think I'd manage that, even if I was frozen solid! It'd knock me block off!

<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv. Them wolves 'ave gone now,
so we should get back to Orkutsk.
<se_low>Yangus: I'm about ready to put me feet up for a bit.
<se_high>Jessica: Munchie to the rescue! Again!
<se_high>Jessica: He's cute, smart, AND he saves us when we're in trouble! He's my hero!

<se_high>Jessica: The voice that drew those wolves away...
I think I've heard it somewhere before.

<se_high>Jessica: I don't remember when or where.
But I'm sure I've heard it!

<se_def>Angelo: So, first he's chased by wolves, then he collapses,
and then he's trapped by falling icicles.
Hardly the luckiest man I've ever met.
<se_def>Angelo: We'll have to make sure his bad fortune doesn't rub off on us.
<se_def>Angelo: ...Although, we have such tragically bad fortune ourselves that I'm sure his mildly unlucky contribution wouldn't make much difference.
<se_def>Angelo: We've already rescued Marek, so we don't need to spend any more time in this claustrophobic hole, right?
<se_def>Angelo: I can't understand what you're thinking sometimes, <hero>. What on earth would bring you back in here again so soon!?

<se_def>Marek: You were just in time, friends.
Had you not come when you did,
I am sure I would have frozen solid.
<se_def>Marek: Please, let us forgo the scenic route and head directly for Orkutsk.

<se_def>Marek: The nook grass may have revived me,
but I am still quite weak.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot we doin' back 'ere? ...Ah, I've got it!
You've come to 'elp yourself to some 'erbs,
ain't ya!?

<se_low>Yangus: But that's thievin'!
An' I s'pose it wouldn't really be fair on Marek.
Better give it a miss, eh?
<se_def>Angelo: I never thought I'd hear Yangus find fault with the idea of stealing! Now I've heard it all!
<se_high>Jessica: Shouldn't we be somewhere else?
<se_high>Jessica: I mean, we have more important things to do than hang out in an empty cave.
<se_def>Angelo: It must've taken a lot of dedication to keep a herb garden going in a place like this.
<se_def>Angelo: I can't understand how people can get so fired up about such things, personally.

<se_low>Yangus: This cave's freezin', an' I don't like the way
them icy-colds keep fallin' down neither.
I'd rather not come 'ere unless we really 'ave to.

<se_low>Yangus: Massive sharp things flyin' at me 'ead 'ave
always give me the willies, see.
I'm funny about stuff like that.
<se_high>Jessica: I hate to state the obvious, but...
<se_high>Jessica: ...Rhapthorne is NOT IN THIS CAVE!
<se_high>Jessica: Sometimes I really don't have a clue what you're thinking, <hero>.
<se_def>Angelo: Looks like Marek's too busy looking after Marta's herb garden to make it out here much.
<se_def>Angelo: It all looks a bit less well-tended than the last time we were here.
<se_low>Morrie: So this is Orkutsk! Brrr, this cold finds its ways to the parts the other colds cannot reach, ay, ragazzo?
<se_low>Morrie: Argh! So near, but so far! The space between the icicles, it is just too small, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: We need to be the size of the mices to make it through there.
<se_low>Morrie: One slip in this land of snow and ice, and you gonna be dead like a doornail in the coffin, ay? We must all be careful.
<se_low>Morrie: When you eat the nook grass, you can breathe fire? FANTASTICO!
<se_low>Morrie: I'm gonna use this idea for a new move I bring to my pit.

<se_high>Jessica: I don't think that's really how it works, Morrie.
But anyway, please don't go trying it out,
all right?

<se_low>Morrie: We should take Marek to the town at once.
Maybe he is very sick, ay?

<se_high>Red: Wot are we doin' in this place, eh?
There's no 'ope o' findin' anyfin' valuable 'ere.

<se_low>Morrie: This story is not gonna write itself, ay?
We gotta get back to the action prontamente!
<se_high>Red: D'you 'ave some kind o' plan, comin' to this freezin' 'ole, eh?
<se_low>Morrie: This cave is not so close to the town. And the way here is so snowy. Looking after this nook grass is a sticky business, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: Marek is a man of great GUSTO!
But no one has more GUSTO than MORRIE of the MONSTROUS PIT!
